trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule"></xref> class.
You can use the ProfileEventArgs class during the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event to specify a custom user profile.

If, when the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event completes, the ProfileEventArgs parameter of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventHandler> has its <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property set to a value that’s not `null`, then the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> uses the value of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Profile%2A> property in the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs"></xref> class.

The ProfileEventArgs creates an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> class and sets the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs.Context%2A> property to the specified <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> of the current request.
Gets the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> for the current request.
The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> object provides event information to the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> class.
The Context property provides access to the <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> of the current request.
The <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref> for the current request
Gets or sets the user profile for the current request.
You can use the Profile property during the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event to specify a custom user profile.

If, when the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event completes, the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventArgs> parameter of the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileEventHandler> has its Profile property set to a value that’s not `null`, then the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> uses the value of the Profile property in the current <xref:System.Web.HttpContext>.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> does not set the Profile property for the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event.
The <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule> only gets the value of the Profile property when the code in the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event completes.
If the Profile property is not explicitly set by application code during the <xref:System.Web.Profile.ProfileModule.Personalize> event, the Profile property value will be `null`.
The user profile to use for the current request.
The default is <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref>.
